result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina L.N. Sharp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------

**NOTE: Restitution was ordered in the amount of $9691.00. Pursuant to plea agreement, the Defendant has paid a total of $1,350.00, which has been distributed to victims directly leaving a balance due of $8,341.00. Court enters civil judgment for remaining restitution as follows:
----------------------------------
Judgment is hereby granted against the defendant and in favor of the victims listed below for the amounts shown below. Clerk is directed to docket said judgments without fee:

Gary Reiley - $2055.00
W5920 Willow Bend Road
Walworth, WI  53184

803 S. Wells Street
Lake Geneva, WI  53147

Court in session at 9:04 am. Court appearances made. Christina Sharp in custody w/Atty Melissa Nepomiachi. Haley Rea for the State of Wisconsin. 9:06 am  Court receives documents. 
9:07 am  ADA Rea makes statement of who is requesting restitution. ADA Rea presents exhibit #13, which is marked. Court receives exhibit #13. ADA Rea summarizes amounts being requested. 
9:11 am  Atty Nepomiachi makes statement regarding restitution amounts being requested to certain individuals to be set at zero. Atty Nepomiachi makes statement regarding defendants ability to pay under circumstance of this still being an open case.  Court makes statement to have this held at a separate hearing.
9:21 am   State calls witness Gary P Reiley who is duly sworn by clerk on direct exam of ADA Rea.  Atty Nepomiachi makes request to have witness sequestered. 
9:31 am   Cross exam by Atty Nepomiachi. 
9:36 am   Atty Nepomiachi presents exhibit #14, which is marked. 
9:45 am   Atty Nepomiachi goes through exhibit #14 list to clarify items and amounts being requested for restitution.
10:18 am  Redirect by ADA Rea. 
10:22 am  Court questions witness.
10:23 am  Re-cross by Atty Nepomiachi.
10:24 am  Court takes recess and to resume at 10:30 am.
10:33 am  Court back in session.

10:40 am  Cross exam by Atty Nepomiachi.
10:43 am  Court receives exhibit #14.
10:43 am  Atty Nepomiachi goes through exhibit #14 list to clarify items and amounts being requested for restitution. Court receives exhibit #14.

11:15 am  Court receives exhibit #15.

11:21 am  State presents exhibit #16, which is marked. Court receives exhibit #16.
11:22 am  Cross exam by Atty Nepomiachi. Atty Nepomiachi goes through exhibit #13 & #14 list to clarify items and amounts being requested for restitution.
11:35 am  Redirect by ADA Rea.
11:38 am  Recross by Atty Nepomiachi.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christina L.N. Sharp in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH G.P.R.  NO CONTACT WITH B.A. 11/22/79 OR L.A. 2/19/83. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
